title: The best micro SD card for my honor 4x?

thread.text:
Hi, my phone is " Huawei honor 4x " and i want to buy a fast sd card to use on it for now, and also I want to pick up something that doesn't get worn out (speed) in soon future if I wanted to use it on an faster phone that supports its full speed. 
My current sd card is a 16gb "class 6" (Read:6mg/s, Write:2mg/s) that I guess is the reason my phone is a little slow. 
So I found this "Lexar high-performance UHS-I U3 Class 10 633x microSDHC 32gb" and my question is does it perform well on honor 4x? please share your thoughts and your experiences with me, thanks
SD cards are not phone specific. Hard to go wrong with most ultra class 10's. My preference is SanDisk, but sure Lexar will be just fine.

cuase I see some people are not happy with lexar on their phones, it seems it's better to buy a samsung for a phone

title: I can't install apps on my honor 4x

thread.text: When I install apps in my app installer it doesn't works it only shows installing. It shows that for many long and the app will not be installed

Welcome to Android Central! Moved from the KitKat forum to the Honor 4X forum.
Are you installing from the Play Store, or from some other source? Does this happen on both wi-fi and mobile data?
Try going to Settings>Apps>All, select Google Play Store, and Clear Cache/Clear Data, then Force Stop. Do the same for Download Manager. Now try again.
If that doesn't work, try going to Settings>Accounts-Google, select your Google account, and remove it completely from the phone. Then add it back again, and see if that helps.

title: Unique signal problem, how can I fix it?

thread.text:
I am using honor 4x from past 1 year. From last week I am facing a unique issue. SIM 2 signal is not working with Vodafone in some areas of the city (for example it will not work in my home). Vodafone Signal is perfect with other mobiles in my home. Same Vodafone sim is working perfectly when I go to office (just 3 KM away from home). I tried to swap SIM-1 & 2. My BSNL SIM works normal either in SIM-1 or SIM-2 slots. Following things I tried. Put Vodafone SIM in SIM 1 - Same problem. Tried some other Vodafone SIM - Same problem. Put the Vodafone SIM in another mobile - Works perfectly. Calling to that Vodafone number while in home - Message says "Seems you dialed a wrong number". Changed the Vodafone SIM for same number - No luck, it wont work in home. Experimented with lot of setting changes - No luck. It works, without any settings changes it works normally in my office.
Called Vodafone call center - No use, they never heard such problem . Can any one suggest me what could be the problem.
Welcome to Android Central! I'd try asking Vodafone for a replacement SIM.

title: Huawei Honor 4a/x SCL-TL00 stuck on FATBOOT&RESCUE MOD. How to fix?

thread.text:
My phone Huawei Honor 4a, SCL-TL00 4glite. 
It was delivered loaded with Chinese bloatware and no access to Google infrastructure.
I rooted it with Kingroot after unlocking the bootloader using HUAWEI website. I then flashed a twrp recovery, using fastboot . I prepared the Cyanogenmod ROMs and the Google bits on an SC card, ready to go. I rebooted the phone a couple of times using fastboot reboot, then tried to access the recovery mode using power+volumeup keys and it went straight into Fastboot&Rescue mode. It now will connect to fastboot but is not recognized by adb. I can flash to it (I tried a couple of alternative recovery images and they flashed ok, but made no difference). The question is - how do I get the phone to boot normally? I have tried manual reboots using different key combos, I have removed the battery, left it for 24 hours and retried. I have googled this and there seem to be plenty of examples of it happening, but none properly resolved on various forums.
Please help me.
Is there anyway to factory reset or just flashing stock kernel? My phone is unlocked and rooted.
Moved to the Honor 4X forum.

title: where is the data of apps location after updating the apps which moved to sd card before??

thread.text:
when i update any app which i already move it to sd card before , i find it go back again on phone memory.
My question is when this happens , is the data still on sd card or move also to phone memory??

When apps on SD card are updated, they go back (all of it) to internal memory. Only files that the app's specific settings have saved directly to SD Card stay there. You can move the app back to SD Card (although the main app file will always reside in internal memory), but if you update again, since all app installs and updates are handled in the internal memory, it will be moved back.

title: Can I set band frequency issue of Chinese Honor 4x in Pakistan?

thread.text: I purchased honor 4x in china but it is not picking up 3g and 4g in pakistan, Is there any solution to fix this problem, Its bands frequeny does not adjust with 3g and 4g frequency in pakistan.
What model is your phone?

The frequency is determined by the hardware, there's no software change you can make that will change it. We need to know not only the model of your phone, but the name of your carrier. (If it's Warid, the only one that seems to offer 4G in Pakistan, the phone has to be model LO4.) Mobilink, Telenor, Zong (Paktel) and Ufone offer 3G, and your phone should work with them. (Warid doesn't offer 3G at all, only 4G.)

bro i am from Pakistan...you cant change the frequencies... thats the truth..

title: Hisilicon kirin 620 octa-core only ever using 4 cores even when cpu load is 100, what should I do?

thread.text:
Hi, 
I own a huawei honor 4x (che2-l11), in the uk, and it has a kirin 620 octa-core processor, where all 8 cores run up to 1.2ghz. Looking at the CPU information on antutu, it only ever showed 4 cores being active, cores 0,1,2 and 3, and never cores 4,5,6 and 7. Also, even though it showed them as 'sleep', it still shows they are operating at 99%. So, I installed CPU-Z, and it showed that cores 0,1,2 and 3 were on, and cores 4,5,6 and 7 were 'stopped'. So I started an antutu benchmark, and cores 4,5,6 and 7 still did not turn on, even when CPU load was 100%. Also, one week, it started giving me antutu scores of around 26000, not 31000. Is this a problem? Should I return the phone to amazon?

Hey!
Maybe you have a power saver on that doesn't let it run all the 8 cores? I don't think it's really a problem. You should look for a program like UnparkCPU or something similar to that. Maybe they are just asleep or just turned off, surf around in settings? I used the UnparkCPU on my AMD based PC and it worked fine then. Just make sure the battery won't drain extremely fast.
I have same problme man,what i need to do ? ;(

title: Need help!! Battery is suddenly draining in a great deal in my Huawei Honor 4x. How can I solve this issue?

thread.text:
I am using huawei honor 4x for over one month now. My phone loses charge in a great deal when I am not using it (when the screen is off). It's like 20% in 6-7 hours. some days i find the phone dead in the morning. It basically started since I am using both sim slots. Is it normal? Cause while I was using single sim the phone never consumed a single percent of charge while the screen was off. i can't tell what is eating the battery so much when i am not using the phone.
Did anyone face this issue and solved it? Please help. Thanks in advance.
N.B. I do check that there is nothing running on the background and all the settings are set to optimize.
Have a look thro' the following article :-How to Optimize Your Android Phone’s Battery Life Using Greenify

Welcome to the forums. Sounds like the second sim has a weak signal. Or perhaps there is a data plan connected to SIM #2, and there is no data radios in the second sim slot? Either way, that is like the phone straining to find a signal which is always a battery killer.

hi im using honor 4x mobile my sudenly runing media server its during my phone battery life how to stop thwe media server runing plz help to me
regards
karthi

I bought my phone like 8 days ago. And suddenly the battery experience wasn't the best. It showed me that i can do only 15 hours with 100% battery and 21 hours in Ultra mode. So i checked what was eating up my battery and saw that Android OS was using ~45% and Android System ~20% of my battery. So i RMA'd it and we'll see, if they give me a new phone or fix the bug. That bug is actually Google's fault because Google owns Android. I even did a factory reset and went straight to see if it's still there and yep...

title: Why doesn't my AT&T sim work properly on my Honor 4x phone?

thread.text: I am currently in Boston ,and my huwai honor 4x phone is not working which has at&t sim in it . I doesn't show any signal .

Welcome to Android Central! I don't think that phone is compatible with the bands AT&T uses. According to these specs on Amazon, the Honor 4x uses the 1800 and 2100 MHz bands for LTE, and uses WCDMA for 3G (which isn't supported by AT&T's network, which is GSM). The only overlap appears to be the 1900 MHz GSM band (2G).
